intro: Barkania stipulacea, commonly known as the stipulate barkania, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is a small annual herb that typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its simple, linear leaves and small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Barkania stipulacea is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
